column4: - It may not... im having issues with my MS keyboard, others work fine
the non-standard keys might need a little extra hacking about on to get working -- but they'll work
hmm -- was linux installed with it plugged in?
hmm, so it did work initially and then died on you?
thats unusual, have you tried reconfiguring xorg around it?
- Ive tried all sorts for now... what puzzles me is sometimes it works fine, even the media keys on it
does your syslog/messages file report anything regarding the keyb?
your apt archive might not fit onto a live CD eh
- Almost all UK ISP's are like that
mine ain't tho -- and if i ever were to subscribe to another's services, i'd ensure i had unlimited access -- 10GB isnt enough a day, let alone a month
uk, virgin media (used to be blueyonder/telewest)
errm, it's available in most towns and cities -- but even with DSL, plenty of ISPs willing to give you unlimited access
- It isnt, you'd really be surprised :) And very few DSL subscribers offer anything near unlimited (check out their FUPs as well)... anyway, bit off topic :)
if you're willing to look for the ones that have uncapped services, you'll find them easy enough - but yea, this is getting !ot
